Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
CAN: The student may be able to draw very basic elements of a single land habitat, like a single tree or a simple grass patch, without distinct labeling.
The student might draw a couple of animals like a stick figure or a basic shape of a squirrel, but without proper size or contextual placement within the habitat.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to draw a variety of plants and animals in a chosen land habitat correctly (e.g., may mix features of different plants or animals).
The student may not distinguish between land and water habitats clearly (e.g., may draw fish in the air instead of water).
The student is not expected to label plants and animals accurately (e.g., may label a tree as an animal or not label at all).
The student is unlikely to illustrate or distinguish patterns of diversity across different habitats (e.g., same animals shown in both habitats without differentiation).
